meanings.definition: Dholes: plural noun, a wild dog native to Asia
meanings.sent1: The dholes roamed freely in the Asian wilderness.
meanings.sent2: I saw a pack of dholes hunting for food in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The dholes decided to have a race to see who was the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The dholes' teamwork was as strong as a family's bond.
meanings.sent5: The howls of the dholes echoed through the night.

meanings.definition: Dholes: verb, to hunt or track dholes
meanings.sent1: We set out to dholes in the dense jungle.
meanings.sent2: The hunters dholes carefully through the thick undergrowth.
meanings.sent3: Let's dholes together and see who finds them first!
meanings.sent4: She dholes with the precision of a skilled tracker.
meanings.sent5: The experienced guide taught us how to dholes effectively.

meanings.definition: Dholes: adjective, relating to or characteristic of dholes
meanings.sent1: The researcher studied the dholes behavior for months.
meanings.sent2: Her jacket had a dholes design inspired by the wild dogs.
meanings.sent3: The dholes-themed party was a hit with all the guests.
meanings.sent4: His eyes had a dholes intensity when he talked about his passion.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the essence of dholes in her painting.
